JobFullDesc: At Bristol Myers Squibb, we are inspired by a single vision – transforming patients’ lives through science. In oncology, hematology, immunology and cardiovascular disease – and one of the most diverse and promising pipelines in the industry – each of our passionate colleagues contribute to innovations that drive meaningful change. We bring a human touch to every treatment we pioneer. Join us and make a difference.The Manager, External Manufacturing Sourcing leads sourcing and contracting processes for Contract Manufacturing and is responsible for key deliverables within category strategy development for larger categories with complex scope. The incumbent also leads select Supplier Relationship Management processes in alignment with BP&S.The role requires strong analytical skills and deep understanding of Total Cost of Ownership for assigned categories in order to generate strategic industry insights and identify category opportunities and competitive advantage for Bristol-Myers Squibb.This role requires strong ability to lead cross-functional teams remotely, working with business partners and suppliers, and managing multiple, shifting priorities on a daily basis with minimal guidance.Job Profile & ResponsibilitiesProcurement:Understand the product lifecycle process, its impact on the organization (short and long term) and apply knowledge of the global value chain to provide strategic industry insights and identify potential opportunities that may shorten/improve product lifecycle or offer integration opportunities across categories that ultimately lead to a BMS competitive advantage.Lead moderately/highly-complex competitive sourcing events and supplier negotiations (depending on category complexity); determine appropriate methods of procurement; solicit bids, quotations and proposals, and evaluate competitive offerings and recommend overall best offer for a product or service.Review and critically assess business specifications and statements of work; negotiate and develop contracts for legal review and approval.Occasionally provide BMS support and oversight to suppliers of Procurement BPO servicesFor escalated issues with respect to quality, performance or supply, support Business Partnering & Strategy with the analytics required to solve root cause issues; collaborate with site / local procurement on solutions. Occasionally own/drive mitigation projects on a prioritized basis.Research and assist in resolving issues raised in Purchasing audit reportsRelationships:Apply analytics to ensure compliance by preferred suppliers and with contract terms; provide analytical tools to support management of preferred suppliersOccasionally support the review of supplier innovations and demonstrations in partnership with the Business Partnering and Strategy group for prioritized Tier 1 suppliersSupport Business Partnering & Strategy in communicating purchasing policies and procedures to users when neededMaintain effective relationships with suppliers and user departments, help BP&S resolve escalated quality problems, and help identify measurements for improvement and target-setting coordinate review and respond to supplier inquiriesLead and participate in organizational development efforts in Sourcing Excellence, such as process improvement, capabilities and junior staff development; manage the group’s CoOp program: select, onboard, manage and develop CoOp employeesLead Sourcing Excellence initiatives on improvements to capabilities, process, technologies, communications and organization cultureSupplier Management:Support Business Partnering & Strategy in managing preferred suppliers using the BMS Supplier Management methodology and compliance requirementsManage selected internal and external relationships with suppliers, cross-functional and/or multi-functional teamsConduct Business Continuity Management and Risk Management activities; develop and implement scorecards and track supplier performanceSupport Change Management activity around systems including Vendor Change Notification and Approved Supplier List (for direct material / GPS roles)Indirect Reports:Key Business Partners CoOp employees (occasional)1-2 Sourcing Analysts (occasional)Internal/External Contacts/Customers:Sales representatives and Managers within supplier baseKey business partner contacts (Manager and Director level)Unit leadsLegal and Strategic Corporate Transactions teamsRequired Experience:Bachelor’s Degree (Science or Engineering desirable)Minimum of 5 years work experience and at least 3 years Procurement experienceAt least 3 years relevant industry experience; preferred category experience includes Contract Manufacturing, Biologics Manufacturing, Active Pharmaceutical Ingredients (‘API’or other science-based industries, Packaging ServicesProficiency in managing contract development and complianceIdeal Candidates Would Also Have:Relevant industry certifications (e.g. Certified Purchasing Manager (CPM), Certified Professional in Supply Management (CPSM), Certified Supply Chain Professional (CSCP), Certified in Production and Inventory Management(CPIM))Knowledge and proficiency with SAP, Ariba and other management and financial information systemsOther qualifications:US military experience will be considered towards industry and professional experience requirementsAbout Sourcing ExcellenceDevelopment Value Sourcing Excellence is a fungible pool of talent and future leaders for Global Procurement.
